content:
Hi, I'm working on stabilizing feature(move_ref_pattern)

I'm working on documentation now (see 76049), So in the reference I used code that explains this feature, but since this feature is not stable, I can't use it directly and need to add

#![feature(move_ref_pattern)]

I guess its not ok to do it in the reference, what should I do?
you could document it in the unstable book.
And then remove it in the stabilizing PR?
yah, I'm working in the reference not the book
often move it to reference after the stabilizing PR merged.
Doesn't have to strictly follow it, but we have establish process so
The reference PR won't be merged until the feature is actually stabilized on nightly.
Ok, I'll be proceeding to next step. Do you know where to write the stabilization report?
could be in the tracking issue of the feature or the stabilizing PR
